definition: The Legend of the Red Lantern
to record/to note/to memorize/to remember/mark/sign/classifier for blows, kicks, shots
lit. lively dragon and animated tiger (idiom)/fig. vigorous and lively
lit. to use a dog's tail as a substitute for sable fur (idiom)/fig. a worthless sequel to a masterpiece
to use the past to disparage the present (idiom)
to think for oneself and act accordingly (idiom); to act on one's own initiative
engraved in one's heart and carved in one's bones (idiom); to remember a benefactor as long as one lives/undying gratitude
to plan a military mission on a sand table (idiom)/to rehearse a planned action or activity/to conduct a dry run
Your presence brings light to my humble dwelling/see also 蓬蓽生光|蓬荜生光[peng2 bi4 sheng1 guang1]
to run in parallel without hindrance/not mutually exclusive/two processes can be implemented without conflict
